channel.title: 法律行业和律师事务所新闻 | 路透社
channel.description: 在 Reuters.com 上查找来自全球各个角落的最新法律行业新闻，它是您获取突发国际新闻报道的在线来源。 - 由 RSSHub 提供支持

item.title: 随着刑事调查的继续，ADM 股东敦促首席执行官辞职
item.description: 农业综合企业阿彻丹尼尔斯米德兰 (Archer-Daniels-Midland) 的一名股东正在敦促该公司首席执行官辞职，原因是该公司未能清楚地告知投资者其内部会计实践中存在的问题，从而引发了路透社首次报道的刑事调查。

item.title: Citgo 股票拍卖法官驳回阻止 Gramercy 基金诉讼的请求
item.description: 美国一名法官在周一发布的命令中裁定，三家公司为提高在 Citgo Petroleum 母公司股票拍卖中获得收益的机会而提起的诉讼可以继续进行。

item.title: 已退休的美国最高法院法官布雷耶将于明年 1 月出任上诉法院法官
item.description: 已退休的自由派美国最高法院法官斯蒂芬·布雷耶计划在 2025 年初做一件他两年多来未曾做过的事：审理案件，这次他是作为波士顿联邦上诉法院的客座法官。

item.title: 美国前总统卡特打破司法多元化纪录
item.description: 卡特执政四年来，任命创纪录数量的女性和有色人种担任联邦法官，这使他成为第一位显著实现司法系统多元化的总统。

item.title: 律所争夺市场份额推动新年并购浪潮
item.description: 新的一年将迎来美国各地一系列大型律师事务所合并，从而给 2025 年的法律行业带来更多整合。

item.title: 民主党议员质疑美国新司法财务披露政策
item.description: 国会两名民主党议员正在寻求有关美国新司法政策的更多信息，该政策规定美国最高法院法官和其他联邦法官何时必须公开披露他们之前未报告的旅行相关礼物。

item.title: Jana Partners 任命第六位高管，推动 Lamb Weston 变革，文件显示
item.description: 根据周五提交的监管文件显示，Jana Partners 正在与第六位高管合作，推动 Lamb Weston 进行变革，这表明这位激进投资者可能寻求更换这家炸薯条制造商董事会的大多数成员。

item.title: 2025 年科技公司将面临严峻的人工智能版权问题
item.description: 新的一年可能会带来一系列版权诉讼的关键进展，这些诉讼可能会影响人工智能的未来业务。

item.title: 根据新气候法，纽约将对化石燃料公司处以 750 亿美元罚款
item.description: 根据州长凯西·霍楚尔周四签署的一项法案，纽约州将在未来 25 年内向化石燃料公司处以总计 750 亿美元的罚款，以弥补其对气候造成的损害。

item.title: 2024 年美国法律行业撤离中国势头进一步增强
item.description: 2024年，美国主要律师事务所迅速撤出大中华区法律市场，凸显出外国律师事务所在世界第二大经济体的前景不明朗。

item.title: 美国法官承认与政治关联俱乐部对话“犯了错误”
item.description: 一名联邦法官承认，他在一个未具名的“政治附属俱乐部”发表演讲违反了司法道德规则，并已采取措施确保他的演讲从该组织的 YouTube 频道上删除。

item.title: 泰森食品等家禽加工企业将支付 1.8 亿美元以解决工人的工资索赔
item.description: 泰森食品和其他八家家禽加工商已同意支付 1.8 亿美元，以解决美国法院指控他们合谋压低家禽工人工资的诉讼，该协议使得该案的总和解金额达到近 4 亿美元。

item.title: 前法官结束了针对 Hagens Berman 律师事务所的制药费用裁决诉讼
item.description: 一位前联邦法官兼一家制药公司的董事撤回了他的诉讼，该诉讼指控全国原告律师事务所 Hagens Berman Sobol Shapiro 未能向他支付在起诉制药商惠氏的诉讼中应得的律师费。

item.title: 凯勒·波兹曼放弃诉讼后，Tubi 大规模仲裁将继续推进
item.description: 律师事务所凯勒波斯特 (Keller Postman) 撤销了在洛杉矶对流媒体视频网站 Tubi 提起的诉讼，该诉讼指控该网站存在诉讼不当行为，双方互相指责 Tubi 歧视其用户，并且凯勒波斯特向 Tubi 提出了毫无根据的大规模仲裁索赔。

item.title: 西弗吉尼亚州律师协会因指定黑人成员担任董事会席位而遭起诉
item.description: 一个反对种族和性别偏好的全国性组织周四起诉西弗吉尼亚州律师协会的领导人，声称在其理事会中为黑人成员预留一个席位的政策是歧视性的。

item.title: ADM shareholder presses CEO to resign as criminal probe continues
item.description: A shareholder of agribusiness Archer-Daniels-Midland is pressing the company's CEO to resign for failing to clearly tell investors about problems with its internal accounting practices that have sparked a criminal investigation first reported by Reuters.

item.title: ADM shareholder presses CEO to resign as criminal probe continues
item.description: A shareholder of agribusiness Archer-Daniels-Midland is pressing the company's CEO to resign for failing to clearly tell investors about problems with its internal accounting practices that have sparked a criminal investigation first reported by Reuters.

item.title: Judge in Citgo share auction rejects bid to block Gramercy fund lawsuits
item.description: Lawsuits by three firms seeking to improve their chances of obtaining proceeds in an auction of shares in Citgo Petroleum's parent can go ahead, a U.S. judge ruled in an order issued on Monday.

item.title: Judge in Citgo share auction rejects bid to block Gramercy fund lawsuits
item.description: Lawsuits by three firms seeking to improve their chances of obtaining proceeds in an auction of shares in Citgo Petroleum's parent can go ahead, a U.S. judge ruled in an order issued on Monday.

item.title: Retired US Supreme Court Justice Breyer to sit with appeals court in January
item.description: Retired liberal U.S. Supreme Court Justice Stephen Breyer plans to kick off 2025 by doing something he has not done in over two years: hear cases, this time as a visiting judge on the federal appeals court in Boston.

item.title: Retired US Supreme Court Justice Breyer to sit with appeals court in January
item.description: Retired liberal U.S. Supreme Court Justice Stephen Breyer plans to kick off 2025 by doing something he has not done in over two years: hear cases, this time as a visiting judge on the federal appeals court in Boston.

item.title: Former US President Carter broke records diversifying judiciary
item.description: Carter's four years in office were marked by a record number of women and people of color being named to serve on the federal bench, making him the first president to significantly diversify the judiciary.

item.title: Former US President Carter broke records diversifying judiciary
item.description: Carter's four years in office were marked by a record number of women and people of color being named to serve on the federal bench, making him the first president to significantly diversify the judiciary.

item.title: Law firms' quest for market share drives New Year's merger wave
item.description: The new year will usher in a slate of major law firm mergers across the United States, bringing more consolidation to the legal industry in 2025.

item.title: Law firms' quest for market share drives New Year's merger wave
item.description: The new year will usher in a slate of major law firm mergers across the United States, bringing more consolidation to the legal industry in 2025.

item.title: Democratic lawmakers question new US judicial financial disclosure policy
item.description: Two Democratic lawmakers in Congress are seeking further information about a new U.S. judiciary policy governing when U.S. Supreme Court justices and other federal judges must publicly disclose travel-related gifts they that they had previously failed to report.

item.title: Democratic lawmakers question new US judicial financial disclosure policy
item.description: Two Democratic lawmakers in Congress are seeking further information about a new U.S. judiciary policy governing when U.S. Supreme Court justices and other federal judges must publicly disclose travel-related gifts they that they had previously failed to report.

item.title: Jana Partners signs up sixth executive as it pushes for changes at Lamb Weston, filing shows
item.description: Jana Partners is working with a sixth executive to push for changes at Lamb Weston, signaling the activist investor may seek to replace the majority of the french fry maker's board, according to a regulatory filing made on Friday.

item.title: Jana Partners signs up sixth executive as it pushes for changes at Lamb Weston, filing shows
item.description: Jana Partners is working with a sixth executive to push for changes at Lamb Weston, signaling the activist investor may seek to replace the majority of the french fry maker's board, according to a regulatory filing made on Friday.

item.title: Tech companies face tough AI copyright questions in 2025
item.description: The new year may bring pivotal developments in a series of copyright lawsuits that could shape the future business of artificial intelligence.

item.title: Tech companies face tough AI copyright questions in 2025
item.description: The new year may bring pivotal developments in a series of copyright lawsuits that could shape the future business of artificial intelligence.

item.title: New York to fine fossil fuel companies $75 billion under new climate law
item.description: New York state will fine fossil fuel companies a total of $75 billion over the next 25 years to pay for damage caused to the climate under a bill Governor Kathy Hochul signed into law on Thursday.

item.title: New York to fine fossil fuel companies $75 billion under new climate law
item.description: New York state will fine fossil fuel companies a total of $75 billion over the next 25 years to pay for damage caused to the climate under a bill Governor Kathy Hochul signed into law on Thursday.

item.title: US legal industry's China retreat gained steam in 2024
item.description: Major U.S. law firms scaled back from Greater China's legal market at a rapid pace in 2024, highlighting an uncertain future for foreign firms in the world's second largest economy.

item.title: US legal industry's China retreat gained steam in 2024
item.description: Major U.S. law firms scaled back from Greater China's legal market at a rapid pace in 2024, highlighting an uncertain future for foreign firms in the world's second largest economy.

item.title: US judge acknowledges 'mistake' in speaking to politically affiliated club
item.description: A federal judge has acknowledged he violated judicial ethics rules by speaking before an unnamed "politically affiliated club" and has taken steps to ensure the presentations he gave were removed from the group's YouTube channel.

item.title: US judge acknowledges 'mistake' in speaking to politically affiliated club
item.description: A federal judge has acknowledged he violated judicial ethics rules by speaking before an unnamed "politically affiliated club" and has taken steps to ensure the presentations he gave were removed from the group's YouTube channel.

item.title: Tyson, other poultry processors to pay $180 million to settle workers’ wage claims
item.description: Tyson Foods and eight other poultry processors have agreed to pay $180 million to resolve a lawsuit in U.S. court claiming they conspired to suppress poultry workers' wages, in an agreement that pushes total settlements in the case to nearly $400 million.

item.title: Tyson, other poultry processors to pay $180 million to settle workers’ wage claims
item.description: Tyson Foods and eight other poultry processors have agreed to pay $180 million to resolve a lawsuit in U.S. court claiming they conspired to suppress poultry workers' wages, in an agreement that pushes total settlements in the case to nearly $400 million.

item.title: Ex-judge ends lawsuit against law firm Hagens Berman over pharma fee award
item.description: A former federal judge and director at a pharmaceutical company has dropped his lawsuit accusing national plaintiffs' law firm Hagens Berman Sobol Shapiro of failing to pay him his share of attorney fees from a lawsuit against drugmaker Wyeth.

item.title: Ex-judge ends lawsuit against law firm Hagens Berman over pharma fee award
item.description: A former federal judge and director at a pharmaceutical company has dropped his lawsuit accusing national plaintiffs' law firm Hagens Berman Sobol Shapiro of failing to pay him his share of attorney fees from a lawsuit against drugmaker Wyeth.

item.title: Tubi mass arbitration to move forward after Keller Postman drops lawsuit
item.description: Law firm Keller Postman is dropping a lawsuit in Los Angeles that accused video streaming site Tubi of litigation misconduct, as the two sides exchange accusations that Tubi discriminated against its users and that Keller Postman bombarded Tubi with unfounded mass arbitration claims.

item.title: Tubi mass arbitration to move forward after Keller Postman drops lawsuit
item.description: Law firm Keller Postman is dropping a lawsuit in Los Angeles that accused video streaming site Tubi of litigation misconduct, as the two sides exchange accusations that Tubi discriminated against its users and that Keller Postman bombarded Tubi with unfounded mass arbitration claims.

item.title: West Virginia Bar sued over board seat designated for Black member
item.description: A national organization opposed to race and gender preferences on Thursday sued leaders of the West Virginia State Bar, claiming a policy that sets aside one seat on its governing board for a Black member is discriminatory.

item.title: West Virginia Bar sued over board seat designated for Black member
item.description: A national organization opposed to race and gender preferences on Thursday sued leaders of the West Virginia State Bar, claiming a policy that sets aside one seat on its governing board for a Black member is discriminatory.
